intro: Digyroloma, commonly known as the golden cup-mudplantain, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The leaves are usually narrow and alternate, with a slightly hairy texture. The plant is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
